newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian palm oil higher on tight supply.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian palm oil higher on tight supply.

text.p: Indonesian palm oil was higher in late trade on Friday amid continuing tight supply in the domestic market, traders said.
"Demand remains stable, but tight supply keeps boosting prices up. The trend is still on the upside," one trader said.
They said ready palm olein was higher at 1,550-80 rupiah/kg in Jakarta and Surabaya, while olein in Medan was higher at 1,470 rupiah from 1,460 in the morning trade.
Traders said no tender of crude palm oil was heard on Friday. A tender of 2,000 tonnes of crude palm oil was sold at 1,215 rupiah/kg on Thursday, compared with 1,175 rupiah/kg on Tuesday.
